entry.title: II Congreso Cient√≠fico Internacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad de la Universidad de Panam√°
entry.content:
Realizan III Congreso Cient√≠fico Nacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad y el II Congreso Cient√≠fico Internacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad de la Universidad de Panam√°

Ver post original: Realizan III Congreso Cient√≠fico Nacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad y el II Congreso Cient√≠fico Internacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad de la Universidad de Panam√° ‚Äì Revista Hacia la Luz

uphacialaluz
17 octubre, 2025
2 minutos
 

La Facultad de Administraci√≥n de Empresas y Contabilidad de la Universidad de Panam√°, llev√≥ a cabo el III Congreso Cient√≠fico Nacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad y el II Congreso Cient√≠fico Internacional de Estudiantes de Contabilidad, eventos orientados a fomentar la investigaci√≥n, el intercambio acad√©mico y la actualizaci√≥n profesional en el √°mbito contable. Ambos encuentros se desarrollaron bajo el lema: ‚ÄúInnovaci√≥n y Tecnolog√≠a en la Contabilidad Moderna: Desaf√≠os para el Profesional del Ma√±ana‚Äù, y ofrecieron una variada programaci√≥n de conferencias magistrales, ponencias estudiantiles y espacios de di√°logo acad√©mico.

En un escenario global caracterizado por la creciente digitalizaci√≥n de los procesos empresariales y la continua transformaci√≥n tecnol√≥gica del √°mbito financiero, la formaci√≥n de los futuros profesionales de la contabilidad implica la revisi√≥n y actualizaci√≥n de las competencias requeridas para su desempe√±o, herramientas y enfoques aplicados al ejercicio profesional. Conscientes de esta realidad, la Facultad de Administraci√≥n de Empresas y Contabilidad organiz√≥ este congreso cient√≠fico con el prop√≥sito de integrar la teor√≠a y la pr√°ctica en torno a los avances tecnol√≥gicos que est√°n redefiniendo la contabilidad moderna.

El evento reuni√≥ a destacados acad√©micos, investigadores, profesionales y estudiantes del √°rea contable, tanto a nivel nacional como internacional. Entre las actividades m√°s destacadas se cont√≥ la conferencia del Ing. Carlos Cruz, Head of Solution Advisory Cloud ERP and Finance de la empresa SAP, quien present√≥ la ponencia titulada ‚ÄúSAP: Software de Gesti√≥n Financiera‚Äù. En su exposici√≥n, el ingeniero Cruz analiz√≥ las tendencias actuales en el uso de plataformas ERP  de SAP y soluciones en la nube para la optimizaci√≥n de los procesos financieros y contables, ofreciendo una visi√≥n pr√°ctica sobre la integraci√≥n tecnol√≥gica en la gesti√≥n empresarial.

Desde el a√±o 2024 la Universidad de Panam√° cuenta con una alianza con SAP University Alliances para integrar las soluciones y recursos de SAP en su plan de estudios. Esta colaboraci√≥n brinda a los estudiantes acceso a materiales educativos, software y la oportunidad de trabajar en desaf√≠os empresariales reales, fortaleciendo as√≠ sus competencias y perspectivas profesionales en la econom√≠a digital. Este programa es una iniciativa global que busca reducir la brecha entre el mundo acad√©mico y el empresarial, proporcionando a docentes y estudiantes las m√°s recientes tecnolog√≠as de SAP para el aprendizaje y la investigaci√≥n. En la actualidad, m√°s de 600 estudiantes de la Universidad de Panam√° han recibido capacitaci√≥n en la plataforma SAP.

La participaci√≥n de expertos de alto nivel permiti√≥ a los asistentes conocer de primera mano las innovaciones que est√°n transformando la contabilidad moderna, desde la automatizaci√≥n de procesos hasta la anal√≠tica avanzada y la aplicaci√≥n de la inteligencia artificial en la gesti√≥n financiera.

Texto: Redacci√≥n / Foto: Cortes√≠a FAECO

entry.title: Enhancing Flexible Workflows for Purchase Requisitions in SAP S/4HANA Based on Sum of All Line Items
entry.content:
Introduction
In today‚Äôs dynamic procurement environments, organizations need workflow mechanisms that intelligently adapt to business changes without adding unnecessary administrative overhead.
SAP S/4HANA‚Äôs Flexible Workflow framework provides this adaptability ‚Äî but sometimes, additional logic is required to differentiate approval levels based on the extent of change in a Purchase Requisition (PR).

This blog post explains how to extend the standard Flexible Workflow to trigger different approval levels depending on total PR price or amount variation.
The approach uses custom tables, BAdI implementations, and ABAP classes to intelligently decide when a workflow should restart ‚Äî either with single-level or multi-level approval. 

Business Requirement

The requirement is to handle changes to a Purchase Requisition (PR) that has already been released. Depending on how much the PR value changes (Total/Sum of all line items), the workflow should determine whether to restart as a single-step or multi-step approval process.

Scenario Price / Amount Change Approval Behavior

Minor Change0.01% ‚Äì 5% or Amount ‚â§ 25,000Trigger Single-Level approval
Major Change‚â• 5% or Amount > 25,000Trigger All Levels (Standard)

This design ensures minor updates don‚Äôt require multiple approvals, while significant changes trigger the full approval chain.

Solution Overview

To achieve this dynamic behavior, we implemented the following components:

  1. Custom Table (ZTPMM_PR_LOG) ‚Äì Stores workflow flag conditions (X or N).
  2. Custom Class (ZCL_PMM_PR_REL_STATUS) ‚Äì Determines PR change type using change logs (CDHDR, CDPOS).
  3. BAdI Implementation (MM_PUR_S4_PR_WFL_RESTART) ‚Äì Evaluates restart logic for Flexible Workflow.
  4. Condition Evaluation Class (ZCL_IM_PMM_WF_CONDITION_IMP) ‚Äì Validates workflow start conditions.

 

Workflow Flow Diagram

Below diagram shows the complete flow of logic ‚Äî from PR creation/change through workflow triggering.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Custom Table ‚Äì ZTPMM_PR_LOG

We created a custom transparent table ZTPMM_PR_LOG to store workflow type flags and PR numbers.
This table acts as a control mechanism for determining workflow behavior.

Table Fields

Field Key Data Element Description

MANDT‚úîMANDTClient
BANFN‚úîBANFNPurchase Requisition Number
WFTYP ZDE_PMM_WFTYPWorkflow Type (X = Single, N = Multi)

 

Determining Change Type ‚Äì Class ZCL_PMM_PR_REL_STATUS

This class identifies change details from PR change logs (CDHDR, CDPOS) to determine whether a modification is significant.
It compares previous vs current values and calculates the percentage difference.
If the difference falls within or exceeds defined thresholds, it updates ZTPMM_PR_LOG accordingly.

*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Class Name:  ZCL_PMM_PR_REL_STATUS
* Author : Shravankumar Tiwari
* PR Approval Workflow - Get PR status single or Multi level flag
* im_ebeln = importing parameter in class
*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  METHOD get_pr_status.

    CONSTANTS :
      lc_objectclas     TYPE cdhdr-objectclas VALUE 'BANF',
      lc_tabname_eban   TYPE cdpos-tabname VALUE 'EBAN',
      lc_fname_frgzu    TYPE cdpos-fname VALUE 'FRGZU',
      lc_chngind_u      TYPE cdpos-chngind VALUE 'U'.


    TYPES: BEGIN OF lty_cdchange,
             mandant    TYPE cdpos-mandant,
             objectclas TYPE cdpos-objectclas,
             objectid   TYPE cdpos-objectid,
             changenr   TYPE cdpos-changenr,
             tabkey     TYPE cdpos-tabkey,
             fname      TYPE cdpos-fname,
             chngind    TYPE cdpos-chngind,
             value_old  TYPE cdpos-value_old,
             value_new  TYPE cdpos-value_new,
             username   TYPE cdhdr-username,
             udate      TYPE cdhdr-udate,
             utime      TYPE cdhdr-utime,
             tcode      TYPE cdhdr-tcode,
           END OF lty_cdchange.

    DATA: lt_cdpos     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF lty_cdchange,
          lt_cdhdr_top TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF cdhdr,
          lt_cdpos_raw TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF cdpos,
          lv_purchaser TYPE ebeln.

    " Step 1: Get last 2 entries from CDHDR
    SELECT * FROM cdhdr
      INTO TABLE lt_cdhdr_top
     WHERE objectclas = lc_objectclas
       AND objectid   = im_ebeln 
     ORDER BY udate DESCENDING, utime DESCENDING
     .

    SORT lt_cdhdr_top BY udate DESCENDING utime DESCENDING.
    DELETE lt_cdhdr_top FROM 3.   " keep only the first 2 rows

    " Step 2: Get CDPOS entries that match CHANGENR from the above
    LOOP AT lt_cdhdr_top INTO DATA(ls_cdhdr).
      SELECT * FROM cdpos
        INTO TABLE lt_cdpos_raw                         "#EC CI_NOORDER
       WHERE objectclas = ls_cdhdr-objectclas
         AND objectid   = ls_cdhdr-objectid
         AND changenr   = ls_cdhdr-changenr
         AND tabname    = lc_tabname_eban
         AND fname      = lc_fname_frgzu
         AND chngind    = lc_chngind_u .

      LOOP AT lt_cdpos_raw INTO DATA(ls_pos).
        APPEND VALUE lty_cdchange(
          mandant     = ls_pos-mandant
          objectclas  = ls_pos-objectclas
          objectid    = ls_pos-objectid
          changenr    = ls_pos-changenr
          tabkey      = ls_pos-tabkey
          fname       = ls_pos-fname
          chngind     = ls_pos-chngind
          value_old   = ls_pos-value_old
          value_new   = ls_pos-value_new
          username    = ls_cdhdr-username
          udate       = ls_cdhdr-udate
          utime       = ls_cdhdr-utime
          tcode       = ls_cdhdr-tcode
        ) TO lt_cdpos.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDLOOP.

**addional check for change case
    SELECT SINGLE *
      FROM ztpmm_pr_log
      INTO (ls_ztpmm_pr_log)
      WHERE banfn = im_ebeln.

    """Validate the records
    READ TABLE lt_cdpos INTO DATA(ls_cfpos1) INDEX 1. "Latest record
    DELETE lt_cdpos WHERE tabkey NE ls_cfpos1-tabkey.     
    READ TABLE lt_cdpos INTO DATA(ls_cfpos2) INDEX 2. "Old record
    IF  ls_cfpos1-value_old IS NOT INITIAL AND ls_cfpos2-value_new IS NOT INITIAL
      AND ls_ztpmm_pr_log-wftyp  = wc_x.
      ex_flag = wc_x. "single level
    ELSE.
      ex_flag = wc_n. "Multiple level
    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.

üí°Tip: The same logic can be extended for other purchasing documents like Purchase Orders (POs).

Restart Logic ‚Äì BAdI Implementation  

We used BAdI MM_PUR_S4_PR_WFL_RESTART to define the restart conditions for Flexible Workflow.
The following ABAP logic automatically determines if the workflow should restart as single-level (X) or multi-level (N).

(Notes :

  1. Variable lv_curr_total_value and lv_prev_total_value we need to sum all PR line items price from purchasereqitemscure and purchasereqitemsprev. We can create new static attribute table in class and fill information e.g. gt_purchasereqitemscurr and gt_purchasereqitemsprev  global table name
  2. Function module - ZFMPMM_RFC_PR_WF_ZUPD is remote enabled FM we update ztpmm_pr_log custom table from structure ls_ztpmm_pr_log )

"--------------------------------------------------------------------
"*  Custom Logic for Restarting Flexible Workflow for Purchase Requisition
"*  Author : Shravankumar Tiwari
"*  Description : Determines workflow restart logic based on price
"*                 or amount change thresholds (minor vs major)
"--------------------------------------------------------------------

CONSTANTS : 
  lc_x       TYPE wfl_restart VALUE  'X',
  lc_plus_5  TYPE p DECIMALS 2 VALUE '5',
  lc_plus_01 TYPE p DECIMALS 2 VALUE '0.01',           
  lc_rfc     TYPE rfcdest  VALUE 'NONE'.

DATA :
  lv_item_value       TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
  lv_prev_total_value TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
  lv_curr_total_value TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
  lv_diff             TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
  lv_percent          TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
  ls_ztpmm_pr_log     TYPE ztpmm_pr_log, 
  lv_flag             TYPE abap_bool.

"--------------------------------------------------------------------
" Calculate % difference between old and new PR values
"--------------------------------------------------------------------
lv_diff = lv_curr_total_value - lv_prev_total_value.
lv_percent = ( lv_diff / lv_prev_total_value ) * 100.

"--------------------------------------------------------------------
" Check if difference exceeds thresholds (>5% or >25,000)
"--------------------------------------------------------------------
IF lv_percent > lc_plus_5 OR lv_diff > 25000.        
  lv_flag = abap_true.
  ls_ztpmm_pr_log-banfn = purchasereqitemscurr-purchaserequisition.
  ls_ztpmm_pr_log-wftyp = wc_n. "Multiple level
ENDIF.

"--------------------------------------------------------------------
" Check for minor changes (0.01%‚Äì4.99% or ‚â§25,000) ‚Üí Single level
"--------------------------------------------------------------------
IF lv_flag = abap_false AND
  ( ( lv_percent BETWEEN lc_plus_01 AND lc_plus_5 ) OR
    ( lv_diff BETWEEN lc_plus_01 AND 25000 ) ).
  ls_ztpmm_pr_log-banfn = purchasereqitemscurr-purchaserequisition.
  ls_ztpmm_pr_log-wftyp = wc_x. "X = Single level
  lv_flag = abap_true.
ENDIF.

"-------------------------------------------------------------------- 
" Trigger restart if major change detected
"--------------------------------------------------------------------
IF lv_flag = abap_true.
  restartworkflow = lc_x.
  "Store WF indicator for PR: X = Single, N = Multiple
  CALL FUNCTION 'ZFMPMM_RFC_PR_WF_ZUPD' DESTINATION lc_rfc  
    EXPORTING
      im_ztpmm_pr_log = ls_ztpmm_pr_log.
ENDIF.

Logic Summary

Condition Workflow Type Approval Level

> 5% or > 25,000NMulti-Level
0.01%‚Äì4.99% or ‚â§ 25,000XSingle-Level

 

Workflow Start Condition ‚Äì Fiori Configuration

We configured two Flexible Workflow variants in the Fiori app ‚ÄúManage Workflows for Purchase Requisitions‚Äù, each linked to a specific start condition based on the ZTPMM_PR_LOG flag.

Single-Level Approval (Flag ‚ÄòX‚Äô)

Triggers a single-step approval when the Creation Indicator = ‚ÄòX‚Äô.

Multi-Level Approval (Flag ‚ÄòN‚Äô)

Triggers three sequential approvals (Procurement, Project Control, Budget Owner) when the Creation Indicator = ‚ÄòN‚Äô.

Conditional Evaluation ‚Äì Dynamic Workflow Trigger

In the method IF_SWF_FLEX_IFS_CONDITION_EVAL~EVALUATE_CONDITION of class
ZCL_IM_PMM_WF_CONDITION_IMP, we dynamically evaluate workflow start parameters to determine if the condition should be true.

"--------------------------------------------------------------------
"  **Author : Shravankumar Tiwari
" Conditional Evaluation ‚Äì Dynamic Workflow Trigger
"--------------------------------------------------------------------

METHOD if_swf_flex_ifs_condition_eval~evaluate_condition.
  LOOP AT it_parameter_value INTO ls_param_value.
    CASE ls_param_value-name.
      WHEN 'CreationIndicator'.
        READ TABLE lt_purchaserequisition INTO DATA(ls_purreq) INDEX 1.

        zcl_pmm_pr_rel_status=>get_pr_status(
          EXPORTING im_ebeln = ls_purreq-purchaserequisition
          IMPORTING ex_flag  = lv_flag_2
        ).

        IF ls_param_value-value EQ lv_flag_2.
          cv_is_true = abap_true.
        ELSE.
          cv_is_true = abap_false.
        ENDIF.

      WHEN OTHERS.
        cv_is_true = abap_false.
    ENDCASE.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDMETHOD.

Key Benefits

‚úÖEfficiency ‚Äì Avoid redundant approvals for minor PR changes
‚úÖScalability ‚Äì Extendable to other workflow objects
‚úÖTransparency ‚Äì Logs stored in ZTPMM_PR_LOG
‚úÖUser-Friendly ‚Äì Maintained via Fiori, no coding required

Conclusion:  This enhancement enables organizations to make their SAP S/4HANA Flexible Workflow truly adaptive and business-aware.
By combining custom ABAP logic, Fiori configuration, and workflow extensibility, we achieve a balanced approach to automation and control. 

Thank you for learning.

entry.title: Your Influence Opportunity: SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Projects 2025-3 for SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud is a complete, modular Cloud ERP software designed for every business need ‚Äì powered by AI and analytics. With SAP S/4HANA Cloud, you can run your mission-critical operations in real time from anywhere, introduce new business models in your industry, and expand globally with a trusted partner.  

An exciting opportunity to influence SAP has begun with the third cycle in 2025. The SAP Customer Engagement Initiative enables you as an SAP customer or partner, to get early insights into SAP‚Äôs product developments and directly work with the developers to define and shape future product directions. 

The projects will be open for customer registration until‚ÄØNovember 14, 2025. 

 

SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud projects for registration:

 

ERP Finance & Risk

  • Risk Management Lifecycle for SAP Risk and Assurance Management

 

ERP Digital Supply Chain Cloud incl. Ariba

  • Asset Administration Shell (AAS) with SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration
  • Identify un-assessed assets and auto propose draft risk assessments using AI Agent
  • SAP Digital Battery Passport
  • SAP Field Service Management - Improvements for Maintenance Planning

 

ERP Private Cloud

  • Compatible Unit Transformation: Modernizing Compatible Unit Management
  • SAP Responsibility Management in ERP Private Cloud and On-Premise
  • Supply and Demand Segmentation: improvements of functionality and integration

 

ERP Public Cloud

  • A Modern Treasury Experience: New Fiori App for Interest Rate Instrument
  • AI Agent for Accrual Postings SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • AI Agent for Debt Collection
  • AI Assistant for Manual Postings in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Business AI for Product Cost Controlling
  • Joule as Project Assistant: Optimizing Project Execution and Reducing Manual Processes
  • Let‚Äôs Create the Future of US Sales and Use Tax with AI
  • Line-Item Settlement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Manage Statistical Key Figure Values: Potential Enhancements
  • Modernizing Inventory valuation - Lower of Cost or Net Realizable Value
  • Parallel Unit of Measure
  • Review Booklets and MDA: the next level of SAP S/4HANA Reporting and Analytics
  • SAP Responsibility Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP Risk and Assurance Management - Enhance the Task Management user experience
  • SAP Risk and Assurance Management - Exploring Joule use cases and AI features
  • User Interface Masking for Process Industries in SAP Cloud ERP

 

ERP User Experience

  • SAP Fiori Elements for Mobile

 

Seize this opportunity to make your voices heard ‚Äì register on‚ÄØinfluence.sap.com‚ÄØand be a part of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 3 in 2025! If you are also interested in other SAP Customer Engagement Initiative projects that are currently open for registration, check out the full‚ÄØlist‚ÄØhere. 

Warm regards, 

Your SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Team 

Follow-up after registration: When you register for a project, you will be invited to an introductory call‚ÄØwith the SAP project lead. At this point further participation is optional. Typically, all activities are governed by the‚ÄØFeedback Agreement with SAP.

entry.title: SAP Fiori Innovation Day in Dallas focused on the intersection of AI and UX
entry.content:
Thanks to the ASUG Dallas chapter for helping us reach new audiences with SAP Fiori Innovation Day Dallas. We had a dedicated track within the larger ASUG event in which participants could learn about the latest user experience innovations, build an SAP Fiori elements app in less than 90 minutes, and see some sneak previews of AI-powered functionality that we‚Äôre working on. They also asked our sponsors questions during a panel discussion and found many useful tips they could use back in the office.

In the keynote, ASUG CEO, Geoff Scott, made a compelling case that moving to the cloud is a prerequisite for innovation at speed. In his interactive session, he polled the audience to give people a sense of how they compare to their peers in terms of innovation and adoption of various technologies. Many companies were using AI in some capacity, and some rely on multiple AI tools.  It was interesting to see what use cases the attendees find most relevant.

ASUG found that automation and analytics are the top AI use cases.

In the UX Strategy and What‚Äôs New section, Ioannis and Ute talked about the continuing evolution of SAP Fiori, how SAP Fiori elements brings the Fiori design system to apps in SAP S/4HANA, and demoed the Fiori experience in SAP Cloud ERP. They showed new AI-powered capabilities in My Home, such as Recap and recommendations, and explained how AI built into the SAP Fiori elements framework powers easy filter, smart summarization, and error explanation. All of this functionality combines to make business users more productive by making it faster and easier to find the apps and data they need in their S/4HANA system.

We had a day full of learning and fun.

In the partner panel, experts from Mygo Consulting, Qubittron, Mindset Consulting, and cbs Corporate Business Solutions shared their expertise on:

  • How organizations measure the return on investment for UX and AI projects.
  • Where AI playing a role in UX and how agents fit into the picture.
  • The relative value of AI for business users and developers.
  • The top AI use cases that make sense for companies
  • Where to focus your efforts in the near term to gain benefits from AI

Thanks to Sujeeth, Sidhartha, Andy, and Bastian for your unique insights and actionable advice. I found it interesting that many of the topics that people mentioned would be useful in the future were already part of our ‚Äúone more thing‚Äù session at the end of the day.

The hands-on workshop focused on using AI to accelerate the process of building SAP Fiori apps. Participants used AI in three main ways:

  1. Gathering user requirements in a business requirement documents or via sketching
  2. Uploading the resulting document into SAP Fiori tools AI to generate an SAP Fiori elements app
  3. Making further updates and refinements to the application

We used SAP Fiori tools extensively. This is a logical choice since they are built into SAP Business Application Studio.

The final session of the day (and highest rated) was our lab preview / sneak peak at a few projects are currently in development. As with any discussion of future functionality, we made it clear that these demos might or might not turn into actual products. With this in mind, Sebastian and Katja showed:

  • Vibe coding using MCP servers. (Vibe coding was also part of the ASUG keynote, so this is clearly becoming a mainstream topic, at least among software developers.)
  • App Finder to make it easier to find information in your S/4HANA system.
  • Easy Fill, which speeds up data entry by extracting content from an email or other text and using it to update the relevant fields in an app built using an SAP Fiori elements object page.
  • Smart Helpers to make it easier to get your work done in SAP. I‚Äôm being deliberately vague here as we‚Äôll share more at SAP TechEd and its companion roadshows in early November 2025.

Thanks to everyone who made SAP Fiori Innovation Day a success

SAP Presenters (in order of appearance): Ioannis Grammatikakis, Ute Oemler, Sebastian Steinhauer, Katja Zoch

SAP Fiori Innovation Day sponsors: cbs Corporate Business Solutions, Mindset Consulting, Qubittron, and Mygo Consulting

ASUG events team: Nicole Kern, Kara Hughes

ASUG volunteers: Heather Davis, Simon To

Behind the scenes team: all the developers, architects, product managers and other colleagues who built the functionality and set up the demos and hands-on systems.

All the customers: we appreciate your questions, which help us understand your priorities and focus our development resources.

Next steps

  • Register for the monthly SAP Fiori development roundtable call to meet other developers and architects who build SAP Fiori apps.
  • Subscribe to the SAP Fiori development newsletter, in which we share updates on SAP Fiori elements, SAP Fiori tools, SAPUI5, and SAP Build Code every other month.
  • Explore the SAP Fiori Development Portal to see how SAP Fiori elements can boost developer productivity, drive UX consistency, and ensure your apps have the enterprise readiness features your users expect.
  • Join us at TechEd Berlin or virtual or at the next SAP Fiori Innovation Day in Walldorf

entry.title: Reporting and Analytics
entry.content:
Co-Author: Gergana Deneva; in addition, generative AI was used to help create this content

Elevate Your SAP S/4HANA Experience: We Value Your Feedback!

At SAP,  we're committed to enhancing the reporting and analytics capabilities of SAP S/4HANA to better meet your evolving needs. We are therefore excited to invite you to participate in a customer engagement initiative focused on ‚ÄúReview Booklets and MDA: the next level of SAP S/4HANA Reporting and Analytics.‚Äù

Why Your Input Matters

Your insights and experiences are invaluable to us. By sharing your requirements and feedback, you help shape the future of SAP S/4HANA, ensuring that our solutions are tailored to your specific needs. This interactive initiative is applicable for both Public Cloud and Private Cloud Edition users.

What's in it for you?

This customer engagement initiative aims to delve into the next level of SAP S/4HANA Reporting and Analytics. You will have the opportunity to provide feedback and learn more about the following topics:

  • Review Booklets: Explore the latest innovations in report generation and customization.
  • Multidimensional Data Data Analytics (MDA): Discover advanced analytics capabilities designed to provide deeper insights into your business operations.

Your feedback will help us refine the apps, ensuring they align with the requirements of your business.

How to Participate

We‚Äôve made it easy for you to get involved:

  1. Visit the Influence Page: Go to the campaign page on SAP Influence.
  2. Register: Click on the registration link and follow the simple steps to sign up. Please note that the registration period is open until November 15th.
  3. Provide Feedback: Once registered, you will have access to the platform where you can share your thoughts and requirements.

How you'll benefit

Participating in this initiative brings several advantages:

  • Direct Influence: Your feedback will have a direct impact on the product roadmap.
  • Early Access: Gain early insights into upcoming features and innovations.
  • Community Engagement: Network with other SAP S/4HANA users and share best practices.

Don't Miss Out!

This is your chance to play a pivotal role in the evolution of SAP S/4HANA Reporting and Analytics. Your valuable contributions will help us create a more robust and user-friendly platform that meets the diverse needs of our community.

We look forward to your feedback and are excited to collaborate with you on this journey - register now!

Important Dates: Registration Deadline: November 15th

For more information and to sign up, please visit the campaign page.

Thank you for your continued support and partnership. Together, we can drive innovation and create exceptional business solutions.

Information on the SAP Help Portal

entry.title: AI-innovations in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025
entry.content:
The release of SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 marks a significant leap forward in enterprise automation and intelligence, as presented in this product blog by @BeSchulze. This release, the result of two years of focused development, places artificial intelligence at the core ‚Äì seamlessly integrated across business areas to redefine how work gets done.

Central to this update is the new agentic AI framework, where task-specific agents work together under the orchestration of our copilot Joule. More than just assistance, SAP‚Äôs persona-based AI acts as the new interface ‚Äì guiding users through processes, answering questions, and delivering relevant insights within the tools they use every day. Customers can now experience improved transparency, faster decision-making, and simplified operations, with intelligent capabilities integrated directly into their business flow.

Dive into the accompanying video for a glimpse of how these AI-driven capabilities are transforming daily work and setting a new benchmark for enterprise management.

 

 

Agentic Use cases

Asset Management: Maintenance Planner

In the area of Asset Management, planning maintenance activities often requires seamless access to the right tools at the right time. The Maintenance Planner feature, newly integrated with Joule, enhances this process by providing direct navigation to scheduling applications within SAP S/4HANA Asset Management. This innovation means that maintenance planners no longer need to sift through catalogs, as they can intuitively access relevant apps directly from their conversations, such as asking, "How to visualize maintenance work?" and receiving immediate links to resource scheduling applications. By embedding SAP Help documentation into Joule‚Äôs conversational responses, planners gain quick insights and can focus more on optimally scheduling maintenance tasks, thus ensuring that assets are well-managed without the hassle of navigation detours.

Eager to learn more? Check out our SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

 

Finance: Simpliyfying invoice dispute with the dispute manager

Untangling an incorrect invoice can feel like detective work, searching for clues across different systems. Now, with the Dispute Manager agent in SAP Cloud ERP Private your finance team has a new partner. A finance expert can simply ask Joule to pull up a dispute case by its number or show recent invoices for a customer. From that single conversation, they can review the details and then instruct Joule to either reject the dispute or navigate them directly to the app to create a credit note. This conversational approach turns a complex, multi-step investigation into a streamlined and guided dialogue. It not only saves valuable time for your team but also leads to quicker resolutions, helping maintain positive customer relationships.

For more information, please refer to the SAP Help Portal.

 

Finance: Empowering Trade Classification with an AI Agent  

Imagine trying to import a new fitness tracker and facing a complex web of customs classifications, where one wrong choice could mean costly delays. The Joule Agent for Trade Classification in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 makes this task straightforward by analyzing your product's data against global customs rules. For example, it might conclude a fitness tracker falls under the wristwatches category and provide legal notes to back this decision, keeping your team informed and in control. By transforming the complex classification process into a guided interaction, your trade professionals have more time to focus on strategy rather than paperwork. This not only enhances the speed and accuracy of your compliance processes but also strengthens your ability to meet market demands swiftly. With this AI innovation, your business can confidently and efficiently pursue global growth, minimizing delays and maximizing opportunities.

To learn more, consult our SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

 

Sales LoB

Elevating sales efficiency with AI-driven solution quotation management

Speaking of the Sales line of business, where time is of the essence, managing solution quotations can be a complex task. The introduction of Joule as a digital assistant in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 simplifies this process by allowing sales reps to execute tasks like creation, updating, and searching of solution quotations with conversational, natural language commands. This empowers sales teams to focus on high-value opportunities, such as quotations about to expire or those with significant client interest, and make well-informed decisions with clarity and speed. By streamlining the access to critical information, Joule helps reduce operational time and enhances the agility of sales professionals, allowing them to concentrate on building stronger customer relationships and fulfilling sales targets.

 

 

For more information read our dedicated pages on performing release and acceptance of solution quotations and fetching solution quotation information.

 

Seamlessly creating billing documents with AI

Imagine transforming the intricate process of billing document creation into an efficient, effortless operation‚Äîthis is where Joule steps in. The AI-powered capabilities of Joule allow users to effortlessly generate billing documents, whether they stem from a single reference or a collection of sales and delivery documents. This intuitive system supports the creation of both individual and collective billing documents, tailored to meet diverse business needs with pinpoint accuracy. For R&D departments, this means a streamlined workflow where administrative overhead is minimized, allowing more focus on innovation and product development. By simplifying navigation and enabling quick access to essential apps like Display Billing Documents, Joule enhances the accuracy and efficiency of billing processes, paving the way for more strategic decision-making. With this kind of intelligent assistance, your team spends less time on the nitty-gritty and more time driving the business forward.

 For more details, consult the SAP Help Portal.

 

Sourcing & Procurement LoB

AI-assisted creation of purchase requisitions 

Let‚Äôs take a look at the Sourcing & Procurement Line of Business. In this area creating purchase requisitions is a task that demands accuracy and efficiency. With the AI-assisted capabilities of Joule, the process becomes intuitive, allowing users, particularly casual ones, to navigate and complete requisitions merely through conversational prompts. This smart assistance helps in understanding various languages, correcting misspelled data, and even suggesting sources of supply promptly, thereby minimizing manual overhead and enhancing speed in decision-making. By embracing the future potential of speech recognition, Joule promises to make procurement tasks even more seamless, supporting operational purchasers in reducing free text entries and ensuring order clarity.

 For more details, refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Finance LoB

Simplified subscription order management*

In Finance, is often fragmented and error-prone. Teams spend valuable time reconciling contracts, processing changes, and ensuring compliance - effort that slows down financial operations and puts transparency at risk.

Joule tackles this challenge by simplifying subscription management end to end. It guides users through creating orders, automatically filling key fields once core details are entered. Contract information is easy to access and aligned with attributes like customer or product ID, while intuitive summaries provide quick snapshots of activation status. By streamlining these steps, Joule boosts efficiency, improves transparency, and allows businesses to focus on growth rather than administrative tasks.

 

For more information, consult the SAP Help Portal.  

 

Joule for cash management assistant*

Picture your finance team, once bogged down in manual cash flow tracking, now effortlessly navigating a sea of numbers with ease. With Joule, you can quickly verify if due bank statements are received, fetch opening balances, and factor in expected cash flows, all in one seamless process. By providing accurate calculations of expected closing balances, Joule proactively alerts you to potential cash shortages or surpluses. This efficiency not only saves substantial time but also empowers you to optimize cash usage strategically. In a world where timing is everything, having this level of clarity allows your business to maintain a robust financial footing and seize opportunities as they arise. 

 

 

For more details, refer to the SAP Help Portal. 

*planned availability in November 2025  with the  update of Joule framework

Supply Chain LoB

Joule navigation in SAP Fiori apps for extended warehouse management

In managing warehouse operations, finding the right tools quickly can make all the difference between seamless or sluggish performance. With the introduction of Joule copilot navigation in SAP Fiori apps for extended warehouse management, SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 enhances user experience by guiding employees effortlessly to the most suitable applications for their tasks. This AI-driven assistance not only accelerates warehouse processes but also minimizes the need for extensive user training, ensuring employees can focus on their core responsibilities rather than app navigation. The real value lies in the comprehensive insights this innovation provides, empowering users to make informed decisions that enhance efficiency across operations.

 Eager to learn more? Consult our SAP Help Portal.

 

Service Management LoB

Creating follow-ups for in-house service objects with Joule

Now let‚Äôs have a look at the Service Management LoB. Here, Joule's AI-driven capabilities enable service managers to easily search, display, and create follow-ups for in-house service objects using conversational interactions. This human-centric approach optimizes daily tasks by allowing managers to seamlessly access critical information and act upon it without the need for complex navigation. By streamlining these processes, service management teams can focus on what truly matters‚Äîdelivering quality service to their customers. Such enhancements in task efficiency lead to more responsive service operations, ensuring a proactive approach toward managing service demands.

 

 

For more information, refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Research and Development LoB

Intelligent project assistant capabilities with Joule

Navigating through a sea of data is commonplace in Research and Development (R&D) area, yet it doesn't have to be a drain on your team's creativity and productivity. The intelligent project assistant capabilities powered by Joule allow users to derive project data through natural language inquiries without the hassle of navigating multiple applications. This ease of access aids in quickly retrieving updates on project changes, identifying missing parts, and tracking due activities, all through Joule‚Äôs conversational interface. By supporting informational, navigational, and transactional capabilities, Joule transforms project management into a streamlined process, helping teams stay focused on innovation rather than administrative tasks. Moreover, the ability to open projects and WBS elements directly through Joule means that users can engage with their data more efficiently, fostering a productive and satisfied work environment. With these enhancements, businesses can ensure that their R&D projects are not only well managed but also effectively advancing toward their goals.

 

Navigating Bill of Materials with Joule

Imagine a workspace, where accessing Bill of Materials (BoM) is as straightforward as asking a colleague for the latest update, that's the seamless interaction Joule brings to the table. This AI-assisted natural language capability supports end users in navigating and managing BoM scenarios with ease, removing previous barriers to information. With Joule, users can effortlessly access header information, query BoMs by material-plant combinations, and select specific items, all through simple conversational prompts. Such simplification boosts productivity, allowing R&D teams to devote more time to product innovation and less to administrative navigation. By transforming BoM management into an intuitive, efficient process, Joule empowers users to make informed decisions, enhancing operational efficiency and ultimately driving business success.

For more information, refer to the SAP Help Portal.

 

AI-Enabled Precision in Handling Change Records

In Research and Development, managing change records is often time-consuming and complex. Teams must sift through detailed information, track overdue items, and ensure compliance ‚Äì all of which takes attention away from innovation.

Imagine handling change records as effortlessly as discussing project milestones with your team ‚Äì this is the transformative experience Joule brings to R&D operations. Joule simplifies interactions around change records, offering users intuitive access to detailed information at both header and item levels. By expediting the summarization process and enabling status changes, Joule ensures that overdue change records are discovered and addressed promptly, promoting efficient workflow and compliance. The capability to find records based on criteria such as product and reason for change further streamlines the management process, enabling teams to focus on innovation rather than paperwork. With these enhancements, R&D departments can make informed decisions more swiftly, driving their projects forward with the confidence that change management is both smooth and reliable.

 

For more details, refer to the dedicated pages on summarizing change record information and fetching change record information.

 

Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management

Streamlined project financials with Joule‚Äôs AI assistance

Handling complex financial data is one of the biggest hurdles in Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management. Now, picture managing a multifaceted project with the ease of a friendly chat ‚Äì that‚Äôs the vision Joule brings to life. With enhanced project assistant capabilities, Joule enables users to seamlessly access project financial and master data through intuitive natural language interactions. Gone are the days of toggling through applications and complex reports; now, project system users can effortlessly retrieve and summarize financial insights, aligning their focus on high-value tasks. This AI-driven ease not only boosts user satisfaction but also streamlines data collection and consolidation, making project management more efficient and effective. As a result, project teams can better navigate financial landscapes, ensuring that each decision supports the strategic vision. By leveraging Joule‚Äôs summarization and analytical prowess, organizations can enhance precision in project financial control, translating insights into impactful actions.


For more information, refer to SAP Help Portal. 

 

Summary

As we have explored, the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release introduces a transformative suite of AI-driven innovations that redefine what‚Äôs possible in enterprise operations. By harnessing the power of specialized agentic AI and Joule, businesses are now equipped to navigate complexities with clarity and precision, leading to optimized processes and strategic growth. We‚Äôre excited for you to experience these advancements firsthand and to see how they can empower your organization to achieve its goals with new-found efficiency and insight. Thank you for joining us on this journey through the future of intelligent enterprise solutions. Stay connected for more updates by following the with the PSCC_Enablement tag as we continue to innovate and shape the path forward for businesses worldwide. Don't forget to follow me (@Yannick_PTT) in the community as well as on LinkedIn to not miss any updates and insights.

For more information on intelligent capabilities integrated SAP Cloud ERP Private, explore the SAP Help Portal. 

More information

  • What‚Äôs New Viewer
  • From Innovation to Impact: SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Release (SAP News Center)
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Community
  • Help Portal SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • What`s New for Joule Capabilities

entry.title: UX and application development with AI at ASUG Tech Connect 2025 a companion event to SAP TechEd
entry.content:
This year, SAP TechEd has several options to allow you to learn about the latest SAP technologies and how to apply them to your organization. In addition to TechEd in Berlin and the virtual option, there are ‚ÄúSAP TechEd On Tour‚Äù events in Louisville, Sydney, and Bangalore. In this post, I‚Äôll share the sessions on application development and user experience that we are presenting at ASUG Tech Connect in Louisville, Kentucky. As you would expect many have AI -assisted capabilities to make both business users and developers more productive.

 

At ASUG Tech Connect, we have both lectures and hands-on workshops.

Lectures are a chance to hear from SAP experts and have your questions answered in the room.

Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP (Jens Weiler)
Explore on-stack key user and developer tools in the ABAP Cloud development model, now enhanced with generative AI. Extend standard apps and manage custom ones in SAP Cloud ERP and explore transactional, analytical, and integration use cases like the extensibility AI assistant, queries for analytical SAP Fiori apps, and SQL services.
Tuesday, November 4, 2025, 11:15 AM-12:05 PM

What‚Äôs Next: AI-First Innovations in SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Suite (Ullas Holla, Peter Spielvogel)
Get a fast-paced look at how SAP is embedding AI and delivering cross-suite innovations that break down silos and speed up decision-making. We‚Äôll cover the latest highlights from releases of SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Suite‚Äîplus give you a sneak peek at what‚Äôs coming in 2026 and beyond.
Tuesday, November 4, 2025, 3:30 PM-4:20 PM

Customer Show and Tell: From CDS View to Fiori Launchpad: Full-Stack Development with Eclipse ADT with Naturipe (Brian Galloway, Dario Cruz)
This session covers the end-to-end development workflow in the RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition environment using Eclipse ABAP Development Tools (ADT). It demonstrates how to define a data source and expose it via a CDS view, enabling consumption through SAP Fiori elements, Eclipse ADT, and Postman. A live demo illustrates the creation of a simple SAPUI5 application that consumes the same OData service and is deployed to the SAP Fiori Launchpad, showcasing full-stack integration from backend data modeling to frontend delivery.
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 8:00 AM-9:30 AM

Using Generative AI to Accelerate SAP Fiori App Development (Ullas Holla)
AI changes everything, especially for developing business applications. See how SAP‚Äôs latest coding agents let you build SAP Fiori elements apps using a conversational interface. Create apps using Joule, including a CAP service, sample data, and SAPUI5 customizations.
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 4:10 PM-5:00 PM

Creating Better User Experiences with AI-Powered SAP Fiori Apps (Peter Spielvogel)
Discover how the latest AI features in SAP Fiori apps enhance user productivity and streamline onboarding. Starting with My Home and diving into commonly used SAP Fiori apps, see how AI simplifies information access, supports informed business decisions, and fosters seamless collaboration. Explore how conversational interactions are making SAP more intuitive than ever.
Thursday, November 6, 2025, 4:15 PM-5:05 PM

Hands-on workshops give you the opportunity to test the latest SAP innovations and gain access to the same tools and technologies we use to build apps for SAP S/4HANA.

Hands-on Lab: Get Started with ABAP Cloud for Classic ABAP Developers
Familiar with classic ABAP development? Explore how similar development works with ABAP Cloud using the ABAP RESTful application programming model. Use ABAP Cloud to build cloud-ready business apps, services, and extensions that follow clean core principles by default‚Äîon SAP Business Technology Platform and in any edition of SAP S/4HANA.
Tuesday, November 4, 2025, 1:10 PM-3:10 PM

Hands-on Lab: Explore Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities
Learn how to develop transactional applications using the ABAP RESTful application model in ABAP Cloud while leveraging Joule capabilities for ABAP developers.
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 8:00 AM-10:00 AM

Hands-on Lab: Build On-Stack Extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP
Discover how to build extensions, applications, and services with the ABAP Cloud development model, using the ABAP RESTful application programming model and generative AI. You can explore how to extend standard SAP applications, consume public SAP APIs, and build new apps and services from scratch while getting practical insights through exercises
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 1:00 PM-3:00 PM

Hands-on Lab: Modernize Classic Extensions for Clean Core in SAP Cloud ERP Private
Practice clean core extensibility in SAP Cloud ERP Private. Learn how to govern clean core development using the ABAP test cockpit, and how to use the ABAP Cloud development model and clean core extensibility principles to modernize your custom on-stack extensions.
Thursday, November 6, 2025, 1:00 PM-3:00 PM

Discovery Workshop: Start Your AI Agent Journey by Exploring AI Agent Use Cases 
In this discovery workshop, you will learn how AI Agents function and what makes a strong use case. You will identify and prioritize strategic AI Agent use cases for your business. For your selected use case, you will explore how AI Agent capabilities can address your specific business challenges and learn the next steps for designing and building an AI Agent using the SAP Agent Builder.
Thursday November 6, 2025, 1:00 PM-3:00 PM

I hope you can join us.

entry.title: Install custom functions in COHV (2/3)
entry.content:
Introduction

The previous episode demonstrated how to create and register a custom mass processing function code in COHV. Now it is time to implement the function.

SAP standard mass processing functions are implemented with COWORK<code> function groups, e.g. the function group COWORK230 implements the mass processing function 230 Close.

I am going to copy the function group COWORK170 to a custom function group and implement the custom mass processing logic there. Before that, let us execute a couple of preliminary steps.

I am trying to keep to SAP naming convention throughout all the subsequent steps.

 

Dialog structure creation

Copy the COWORK170_SETUP structure to ZCOWORK999_SETUP with SE11.

 

Function group ZCOWB999 creation

 

Function group ZCOWB999 adjustments

Now we need to scan the ZCOWB999 function group and replace all the artifacts of the standard COWB170 function group with our custom objects:

Find object‚Ä¶Replace with object‚Ä¶
CO_WORK170_CREATEZ_CO_WORK999_CREATE
CO_WORK170_DELETE<Z_CO_WORK999_DELETE
CO_WORK170_EXEC_SINGLEZ_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE
CO_WORK170_INITIALIZE_EXECZ_CO_WORK999_INITIALIZE_EXEC
CO_WORK170_SAVEZ_CO_WORK999_SAVE
CO_WORK170_SETUP_PAIZ_CO_WORK999_SETUP_PAI
CO_WORK170_SETUP_PBOZ_CO_WORK999_SETUP_PBO
CO_WORK170_UPDATE_INTERNZ_CO_WORK999_UPDATE_INTERN
COWORK170_SETUPZCOWORK999_SETUP
COWB170PARZCOWB999PAR

The easiest way to do that is to search for the source code of the ZCOWB999 function group for WORK170 string.

Here are my changes:

 

Custom processing logic

As we have copied the function group ZCOWB999 from SAP standard COWB170, for now it works exactly the same way as SAP original and executes the same mass processing logic. The mass processing logic starts at line 129 and ends at line 219 of the Z_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE function.

Let us replace that with same trivial test custom logic:

As you see my custom logic is just to log a message without any actual updates to an order. The goal here is to make sure that each order selected in COHV is processed by the function, that its number is correctly recognized and that the function correctly logs processing messages.

 

Testing

I am running COHV and choosing my 999 custom mass processing function:

Next, I am selecting a couple of production orders and execute the mass processing function:

Finally, I am displaying the processing log:

As you can see each of the selected orders have been processed by the Z_CO_WORK999_EXEC_SINGLE function, which logged the message.

 

Wrap up

The article presents a straightforward method to implement custom mass processing functions in the COHV transaction. Naturally, real life scenarios require actual production order updates, not just logging messages. The updates can be posted by production order BAPIs for instance.

We will look under the hood of mass processing in the next episode and explore more advanced topics like how the functions work together, processing parameterization or test mode. Stay tuned‚Ä¶

entry.title: NOW AVAILABLE!! SAP Ariba Sourcing and Procurement for Public Sector for S/4HANA
entry.content:
Highlight:

  • The solution provides state of the art solution tailored to cater public sector specific needs from Procure-to-Pay and Source-to-Pay business scenarios.
  • It allows customers to switch individual public sector features catering to their business needs.
  • The solution is integration points with external parties for Contract Authoring as well as Record Management.
  • It has multiple extension points available for customers to make it retrofit into custom developments.

 

Features:

The solution features rich set stretched from Pre-awarding, awarding and Post awarding process in the cycle of Sourcing and Procurement.

The solution is built with close collaboration with major public sectors from US and France to ensure the delivered features will resolve their key challenges and overcome the setback from erstwhile solution. Some notable public sector features are:

  • Smart Numbers
  • De-obligation
  • Pricing Arrangements
  • Incremental Funding with Fund Requests
  • Mixed Contracts
  • Multiple Suppliers
  • Novation

Technical Layout:

The complete solution is compile with suite of fiori applications which can work standalone but best suited when worked in symphony.

The solution leverage latest Restful ABAP Programming framework and Fiori Element 4.0 as technology stack.

The solution delivers multiple business switches as well customizing level switches to ensure customer can activate features which is more relevant.

Behind the scene the solution enriched with full power house of standard procurement and sourcing processes.

Some key applications which is in addition to standard procurement and sourcing application:

  • Manage Fund Request
  • Process Novation
  • Process Deobligation
  • Manage Entity Hierarchies

The product is general availability is active from October 8th, 2025.

More features are in the roadmap for the upcoming feature pack 01.

entry.title: Environment, Health, and Safety in SAP Cloud ERP Private | 2025 Release
entry.content:
Welcome to our deep dive into the latest advancements for Environment, Health, and Safety (EHS) in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release. I am thrilled to walk you through the key highlights for this release, collected in close collaboration with our product management teams.

This collection is part of SAP features released on October 8, 2025

 

These are the topics that are covered:

Environment Management

Emission Management:

  • A new overview page providing critical insights of the environmental management process

  • Support for standard, analytical content for the compliance overview

  • Reporting toxic chemical release data to publicly accessible databases such as the E-PRTR

Waste Management:

  • Integration of waste management and purchasing process

  • Integration of waste management and inventory management

 

Workplace Safety

Support for Occupational Health Processes

Incident Management Reporting:

  • Assignment of learning items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning using tasks created from incidents

Management of Change Processes:

  • EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities

 

 

Environment Management 

Emission Management:

A new overview page providing critical insights of the environmental management process

Business Background
The Environment Management Overview page offers businesses a streamlined platform to gain insights into their environmental management activities. Managers can easily monitor performance focusing on key data issues like exceedances, warnings, and missing data collected over the past six months. This enables them to quickly identify areas needing attention and make informed decisions, ensuring alignment with compliance standards and supporting sustainability goals.

Key Features
Users can customize their SAP Fiori launchpad homepage to suit their needs, enhancing decision-making and data monitoring efficiency. The overview page allows managers to quickly access critical environmental data, facilitating prompt action to meet compliance requirements.

Image#1: Environment Management Overview

 

Support for standard, analytical content for the compliance overview

Business Background

In EHS Management, leveraging standard analytical content is essential for improving data-driven decision-making. By adapting existing CDS views, organizations can enhance the SAP EHS Management's environment management component. This enables thorough analysis of compliance data through SAP Analytics Cloud integration, allowing access to real-time data. Consequently, businesses can efficiently monitor tasks, track trends, and address environmental issues, helping managers maintain compliance and advance sustainability efforts.


Key Features
The innovation provides a live connection to the environment management system for immediate compliance data access, accelerating the transition from insight to action in daily operations. It also streamlines the experience for environmental managers by standardizing dashboard content, such as task overviews and trend analysis, aiding in efficient compliance management.

Image#2: Compliance Overview

 

Reporting toxic chemical release data to publicly accessible databases such as the E-PRTR

Business Background

Companies operating within the European Union are subject to stringent environmental regulations, including the mandatory reporting of pollutant releases to public databases like the European Pollutant Release and Transfer Register (E-PRTR). Compiling this data accurately from various sources and formatting it according to specific regulatory requirements is a complex task with significant risk for non-compliance. This new feature directly addresses this compliance challenge by helping to automate the preparation of E-PRTR report files. The system gathers the required data on air emissions, wastewater pollutants, and off-site waste transfers and can generate an initial XML report compliant with EU regulatory standards, significantly reducing manual effort.

Key Features

This feature supports the preparation and reporting of toxic chemical release data for companies in Germany, where the E-PRTR reports must be submitted via the BUBE online data collection software system. It enables the generation of an initial version of the required XML report based on collected environmental data.

Image#3: PRTR Facility Report

 

Waste Management:

Integration of waste management and purchasing process

Business Background

Effective waste management is not just an environmental obligation but also a complex logistical and financial process involving service procurement and timely payments. A lack of integration between environmental management and procurement systems can lead to payment delays, inefficient service acquisition, and poor financial oversight of disposal costs. This new innovation introduces a system that establishes a direct connection between the purchase order, the disposal channel, and the waste transportation document, enhancing the integration of waste management with purchasing processes.



Key Features

This innovation integrates waste management with other logistics processes like supply chain management and procure-to-pay. As part of this new innovation, it is now possible to link one or multiple existing purchase orders, enhancing the integration and efficiency of procurement processes.

Image #4: Manage Waste Disposal Channels

 

Image#5: Hazardous Waste Disposal Channel

 

Image#6: My Waste Transportation Document

 

Integration of waste management and inventory management

Business Background

For organizations that handle significant quantities of waste, managing on-site storage is a critical operational challenge. Knowing the exact location and inventory levels of different waste materials is essential for optimizing storage space, ensuring safe handling, and planning timely disposal shipments. Without a clear view of waste inventory, companies risk inefficient space utilization and potential compliance issues. To provide this much-needed visibility, waste management in SAP S/4HANA is now further integrated with inventory management, allowing for the precise tracking of waste inventory within the warehouse and enabling more efficient on-site storage and better shipment planning.

Key Features

This feature enables the tracking of the inventory of stored waste through deeper integration into inventory management. This provides organizations with greater insights into the specific amounts and storage locations of waste on-site.

 

Image#7: Manage Waste Transfer Requests

 

Workplace Safety

Support for Occupational Health Processes

Business Background

Maintaining employee health and well-being is a cornerstone of corporate responsibility and operational stability. Organizations require a systematic method to manage occupational health programs, from initial risk assessment to ongoing medical surveillance. A disjointed approach can lead to compliance gaps, increased health risks for employees, and significant administrative inefficiencies. This innovation addresses these challenges by providing a structured, integrated framework within SAP S/4HANA. It allows EHS managers and HR professionals to proactively manage employee health based on identified workplace risks, ensuring the right personnel receive the right medical attention at the right time and simplifying compliance management.

Key Features

This feature leverages a central repository to track the occupational health history and related case management for employees. It also drives a risk-based occupational health process with deep integration back to central HR data for comprehensive visibility.

Image#8: Edit Medical Service

Incident Management Reporting:

Assignment of learning items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning

Business Background

Following a workplace incident, a critical part of the resolution process is ensuring that employees receive follow-up training to prevent a recurrence. Manually assigning and tracking this training across different systems is often time-consuming and prone to error, which can delay crucial learning and compromise safety compliance. This enhancement streamlines the post-incident workflow by directly integrating incident management in SAP S/4HANA with SAP SuccessFactors Learning. When an investigation identifies a need for additional training, a task can be created to assign specific learning items to relevant employees automatically, ensuring a more responsive and effective safety culture.

Key Features

You can now assign learning content from SAP SuccessFactors Learning directly to employees via tasks created from incidents. The system automatically checks for the completion of these learning items and can complete the associated task, increasing transparency and efficiency.

 

Image#9: Assignment of Learning Items in SAP SuccessFactors Learning

 

Management of Change Processes:

EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities

Business Background
To effectively manage change, it is critical to know precisely where the change is taking place, especially from an EHS perspective. Previously, linking change requests to a specific EHS-relevant location, such as a work center or storage area, was not possible, which limited the ability to search for and analyze all changes affecting a particular site. This made it challenging to ensure full interoperability between Management of Change and other EHS processes.

Key Features
You can now use the EHS location as a primary reference object within a change request, creating a direct and unambiguous link to a physical area. This enhancement significantly improves interoperability across the EHS solution area and enables more powerful search capabilities. Teams can now quickly and accurately find all change requests associated with a specific EHS location, enabling better oversight, more precise analysis, and a more integrated approach to managing site-specific changes.

 


Image#10: EHS location as new reference object and extended search capabilities



More information / additional links

Thanks for reading this blog post. Stay ahead by following the latest updates with the PSCC_Enablement tag in SAP Community.

You can find an overview of selected innovation highlights across all lines of business in the blog posts below:

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights by Bert Schulze

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 FPS0 Release Highlights by Harish Mangtani

  • Help Portal Product Page‚ÄØ

  • What's New | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Shape the future of Private Cloud Workspace with SAP Customer Engagement Initiative 2025
entry.content:
As part of the new CEI cycle for 2025 we launched a CEI project for Private Cloud Workspace. Registration is open until November 14, 2025.

Private Cloud Workspace is a unified environment for managing technical lifecycle of your private cloud landscape, accessible via SAP for Me. It provides end to end visibility and control ‚Äì from deep system insights to risk management, backup and capacity monitoring, release upgrades, and AI-assisted service requests enabling efficient, secure, and intelligent cloud operations in a single interface.
